meta.description: Thai Airways Royal First Class Lounge at Suvarnabhumi Airport (BKK), Concourse D. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Thai Airways Royal First Class Lounge

location.description: Bang Phli, Samut Prakan, Bangkok, Thailand

lounge.description: Enter a private sanctuary at Suvarnabhumi Airport when you step inside the Thai Airways Royal First Class Lounge. Enjoy a range of luxurious amenities, including à la carte dining, private areas, slumber rooms, and shower suites.

reviews.content: Sadly, the lounge is only separated by half glass walls from the outside, so it's quite loud. Also, the massage offer is only for Thai pax. Swiss or LH pax cannot benefit from the offer.
Fantastic, exclusive lounge with a la carte dining, semi-private Suites, showers, and free massages. Incredible service. One of the best lounges in the world. Don’t forget to try the Pad Thai!
Thai's ground experience is on point. I was very impressed that an agent was waiting for me on my inbound flight on another airline. Food is great, and of course the massage is a unique feature.
This is a first class lounge.  You can order many kinds of real food here, especially Thai food in this lounge is very good. Don't forget to have a free massage.
Great staff, great food and beverages and I just love private rooms and spa services.
Awesome lounge with very friendly staff, nice food and drinks. A good start of you trip with Thai.
TG really excels in ground services, with concierge accompaniment, spa, and luxury lounges. Among my favourite airlines in the world for lounges (with QF).
One of the best lounges ever. Love the semi private rooms, great service and delicious a la carte menu items. Spa access is an added bonus.
Very good lounge, personal Thai touch. Order food from iPad menu. Staff are very attentive and polite.
Amazing lounge, made me feel like royalty.
One of the best FCL (First Class lounge) in the world. Don't forget your free massage.
Great accommodations and very friendly staff who assist business members with questions and more!
One of the best hospitality experiences I have ever had.

Huge, refined and lots of different sitting areas/rooms. IMO, the best food too. Made to order pad thai and curry were excellent. Not crowded at all. Huge step up from adjacent business (Silk) lounge.
Semi-private rooms, and general area very posh feeling. Service extremely attentive and some nice Thai bites and drinks before flight. Nice touch: you are driven to the lounge and to the gate.
Best lounge so far! Friendly staff, clean, plenty of space. Awesome food and drinks. Try the massaman curry, Mojito and MaiTai!
Best feature is the 1 hour Royal Thai massage. Next best is the pickup from the plane by TG staff and buggy ride to the lounge. Semi-private room, showers, nap room. Usually wifi  good. Good service.
The spa treatments here are what stand out vs the actual lounge. The only bonus to the lounge is that less people use it than the J Lounges.
This is one of the best Thai Airways Lounges in the world, in my opinion. Everyone is very friendly, and the atmosphere is calm.
This is an amazing lounge with semi-private rooms with couches, desks, computers and TVs. You can also order from a full menu, and they offer 1-hour, full body massages if you make an appointment.

Fantastic lounge with great service. Good selection of food, and Mo‘t is served. Separate semi private lounge areas with TVs, desks and PCs.  Amazing spa service. Showers and sleeping areas available.
One of the very best lounges. The service is sensational, hour-long massage is amazing, and the fresh-cooked food is delicious.
